In both series, printed materials would be developed related to the
programs to enhance their educational effectiveness for the viewer or listner.
Copies of the programs would be made available on tape for distribution via
the educational media materials centers established by the USOE. Additional
educational benefit might be derived from publication of the scripts in book

3. Develop a sense of in-service teaching films for instructing teachers
in a special course on the Soviet Union. Educational television has been
especially successful in providing refresher or In-service instruction for pro¬
fessional people. It is proposed that a special course be produced utilizing
an outstanding aurthority in the field (1.e. Professor Michael Petrovich, of
Wisconsin) to provide on-the-job training in this particular subject area
with the expectation that teachers could then more competently inculcate
this knowledge to their own students* Text materials, reading, guides, etc. would
be developed to accompany the course. The lessons, recorded on vide© tape,
would be made available for use over television stations or closed-circuit
systems.
To carry out the program outlined in the previous pages requires expenditures
of a magnitude above and beyond the resources of NAEB. During the 10 year
period in which it has had foundation support, complete self-sufficiency has
been achieved for the Tape Radio Network and the Association itself,
despite rising costs, has made long strides toward reaching a basis of self-
support for its core activities. When the headquarters was established, it
was only 16% self-supporting; today b0% of the operational budget is supplied
from its own resources. Ibis means NAEB is now contributing to its own support
at over five times the 19$2 rate. The steady increase in the numbers ofled¬
ucational radio and television stations and the rapid growth in individual
members ( over 250 in the past three months), plus expanding project activities,
promise eventual total, car near total support. We are confident this goal can
be achieved within three years»
